content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
julia> t = Dates.DateTime(2016, 8, 4)
2016-08-04T00:00:00

julia> timezone_bumper(t)
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching timezone_bumper(::Dates.DateTime)
Closest candidates are:
  timezone_bumper(::Any, ::Integer) at In[2]:3
```
```julia
julia> t = Dates.DateTime(2016, 8, 4)
2016-08-04T00:00:00

julia> timezone_bumper(t,9)
2016-08-04T09:00:00
```
